main event: Three elliptical-shaped objects were observed in the sky over Dayton, Ohio on 05/10/1952. The objects were stationary and appeared as brilliant bluish-white lights, observed for about 2 minutes at a low altitude.
interesting points: The objects were separate, not connected, and moved smoothly as they hovered.
The observer(s) saw the lights disappear in seconds and reappear.
The U.S. Air Force conducted research and regarded the information as confidential material.
The questionnaire included details about the observer's location, the duration of observation, weather conditions, and their personal information.
Drawings and sketches were requested to show the shape and motion of the objects.
